alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Dillon; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Dillon, northeastern Darlington and Marlboro Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 658 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dunbar, or 10 miles south of Bennettsville, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Temporary ponding of water across poorly drained and low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Bennettsville, Mccoll, Clio, Wallace, Brownsville, Chavistown, Dunbar, Minturn, Society Hill, Blenheim, and Tatum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
